snippet: Shareholders will receive documentation relating to the $80 billion merger of the commodities trader Glencore International and the mining company Xstrata a month later than previously expected. The two mining companies said on Friday they would...
abstract: Shareholders will receive documentation relating to the $80 billion merger of the commodities trader Glencore International and the mining company Xstrata a month later than previously expected. The two mining companies said on Friday they would distribute the paperwork to investors by the end of May, but still expected to receive antitrust approval for the merger by the end of third quarter, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Glencore and Xstrata Delay Sending Deal Paperwork to Shareholders
